intro: Noccaea firmiensis, commonly known as the Svalbard rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic regions, particularly the Svalbard archipelago. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky and barren environments, showcasing its adaptability to extreme cold and nutrient-poor soils. Noccaea firmiensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, contributing to local biodiversity in one of the harshest environments on Earth.
